availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew Wallace Rule (Johnson County, Kentucky, resident)

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Angeline Spradlin Rule in Johnson County on March 31, 1846. Father of Martha J. Rule, Mary Rule, Sarah E. Rule, Benjamin F. Rule, Roscoe L. Rule, Andrew Rule, Proctor M. Rule, and Melissa Rule. Employed by Benjamin Spradlin as a farmer in Johnson County in 1850. Farmer in Johnson County in 1860. Served in the 14th Kentucky Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from December 10, 1861, to January 31, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 81A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 156.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Johnson County Marriages, 1843-1875, Film #001912950, p. 121 of 239 of microfilm.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 880.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 486.
